title: Train_segmentation: wrong behavior for path creation and further considerations
body:
As users of GDL know, `train_segmentation.py` write its outputs to an automatic path determined by the lines of code [464](https://github.com/NRCan/geo-deep-learning/blob/6852729d0ec03c0c2a6465b7a68039181c8bcbda/train_segmentation.py#L464)-[467](https://github.com/NRCan/geo-deep-learning/blob/6852729d0ec03c0c2a6465b7a68039181c8bcbda/train_segmentation.py#L467) (more or less). 

As can be seen in these lines, when the path exists, `train_segmentation.py` will add a suffix containing the date and time of that very moment when it's being executed.

First of all, it currently doesn't have the behavior that could be expected by a user, i.e. when the suffix is used, `train_segmentation.py` creates a directory with that suffix *only* rather than creating a directory side by side the first training (the one that already uses the name `train_segmentation.py` is trying to set). Also, it creates that "suffix" directory inside the first one, which doens't make sense to me. Different model, different directory. See:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34774759/109216427-840f9680-7782-11eb-9daf-0263d71cf5cc.png)

Well, I've written a lot of text for a very minor problem. This is an easy fix. Anyways, maybe it think we should question this practice. Maybe the suffix should always be added, even for the first run.
